physical_exam.title: Complete Physical Examination
physical_exam.description: Comprehensive medical evaluation by transplant team
requests: Medication list (with doses, routes, start dates)
Provider contact info (clinic name, physician, NPI if available)
physical_exam.why: Transplant centers will not accept "verbal summaries." They need documented clinical judgment.

lab_work.title: Laboratory Work & Viral Serology
lab_work.description: Hepatitis profile, HIV, CMV, tissue typing, viral panel (repeated annually while waitlisted)
requests: Complete lab result reports with: test name, value, units, reference range, date/time drawn
Blood type & tissue typing results (HLA typing if done)
Chronological lab history if labs were repeated
lab_work.why: Complete lab reports provide the detailed information transplant centers need for evaluation.

cardiac_eval.title: Cardiac Evaluation
cardiac_eval.description: 12-lead ECG for all candidates, stress testing especially for diabetics and those over 50
requests: 12-lead ECG image and/or raw waveform file
cardiac_eval.why: Transplant centers often reject summaries and want the original cardiology interpretation.

cancer_screening.title: Cancer Screening
cancer_screening.description: Colonoscopy for age over 50, PSA for men over 45, age-appropriate screenings
requests: Imaging reports (mammogram, CT, etc. if applicable)
cancer_screening.why: Ask explicitly for pathology PDFs — these are often stored separately and forgotten.

pulmonary_tests.title: Pulmonary Function Tests
pulmonary_tests.why: Numbers alone are insufficient — interpretation matters for transplant risk stratification.

psychosocial_eval.title: Psychosocial Evaluation
psychosocial_eval.description: Assessment by social worker and transplant coordinator covering adherence potential, social support, financial clearance
psychosocial_eval.why: Comprehensive psychosocial documentation helps transplant centers assess readiness and support systems.
